meanings.definition: To surpass in crowing or boasting.
meanings.sent1: The rooster outcrows all the other chickens in the coop.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outcrows his friends with his stories.
meanings.sent3: The little bird outcrows the big rooster, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence outcrows her actual achievements.
meanings.sent5: The young singer outcrows the seasoned performers with her powerful voice.

meanings.definition: To crow louder or more frequently than others.
meanings.sent1: The proud peacock outcrows the other birds in the forest.
meanings.sent2: During the sunrise, the rooster outcrows to greet the day.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous parrot outcrows the noisy monkeys in the jungle.
meanings.sent4: His laughter outcrows the chatter of the crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The excited child outcrows the cheering crowd with his loud voice.

meanings.definition: The act of crowing louder or more frequently than others.
meanings.sent1: The outcrows of the roosters woke up the whole farm.
meanings.sent2: The outcrows of the seagulls filled the beach with their calls.
meanings.sent3: The outcrows of the little bird made everyone smile in the park.
meanings.sent4: The outcrows of the trumpets signaled the start of the parade.
meanings.sent5: The outcrows of the fans echoed through the stadium after the winning goal.
